35232142: Severe flooding in Newton Stewart, Hawick, and Peeblesshire has caused significant damage, with calls for more preventative measures and a faster response from authorities.
40143035: Fire at Holiday Inn in Northern Ireland destroys two tour buses, police suspect arson.

36266422: A 67-year-old former scout leader in Lincolnshire and Cambridgeshire faces 22 charges, including indecency with a child, which he denies.
38826984: A man receiving psychiatric treatment at a hospital in Istanbul threatened to shoot himself and others, prompting an evacuation, but there was no hostage situation.
34540833: Simone Favaro scored the decisive try in the final moments to give Glasgow Warriors a narrow victory over the Dragons in a closely contested match.

35890902: Wireless mice are vulnerable to hacking due to unencrypted radio signals, allowing attackers to spoof signals and take control of target computers.

36217333: The Balmoral Show, a 148-year-old agricultural festival in Northern Ireland, celebrates farming, food, and family fun with exhibits, livestock competitions, and entertainment.

38900884: Eddie Jackson's injury is a big blow for the Dragons, but it presents an opportunity for other back-row players like Ollie Griffiths, Harrison Keddie, and James Thomas to step up.

36052570: Oil producers meet to discuss production freeze, but doubts remain over its impact; US stocks fall as energy and tech shares decline.
34944735: Tarantulas have evolved the same bright blue color independently multiple times, likely for visual signaling to other organisms, despite their poor color vision.

33609927: A Jehovah's Witness elder sexually abused his niece and a family friend, but the organization failed to report the abuse to authorities and instead handled it internally, allowing the abuse to continue for over two decades.
33578778: Greece's bailout programme is described as the "greatest disaster of macroeconomic management ever" and is expected to fail, despite the German parliament approving the opening of negotiations.
36888270: The International Paralympic Committee is considering a ban on the Russian Paralympic Committee after a report claimed widespread doping in the country.
36846007: Ben Loader, a former England under-20 international, has joined London Irish from Bedford Blues, bringing valuable Championship experience as the club prepares for a competitive season.

14958201: Manchester City defeated Everton 2-0 after a frustrating first half, with goals from Mario Balotelli and James Milner securing the win for the home side.

34303109: Pope Francis's visit to Cuba is seen as an example of reconciliation, as he helped thaw diplomatic relations between Cuba and the US.
39939090: Rangi Chase, a former England playmaker, has joined Widnes on a short-term deal after being dropped by Castleford Tigers.

37935687: Wales held off a spirited Argentina comeback to win 24-20 in a closely contested match.

36478199: Two inmates at HMP Wayland attempted to steal prison keys, leading to their transfer to a higher security jail and additional time added to their sentences.
34541803: Tim Sherwood, the Aston Villa manager, is facing pressure despite keeping the team up last season and losing key players, and deserves more time to build a new team.
35360841: The Transport Minister wants to streamline the system and cut fraud, while a council suspended tough new guidelines to tackle abuse, leading to genuine cases being rejected.
35550407: Life expectancy for older adults in England has increased, but concerns remain about regional disparities and the need to improve quality of life in later years.
37561590: Nottinghamshire Police is investigating over 600 reported cases of abuse at council properties between the 1940s and 1990s, with 485 alleged offences committed by council staff.

18536236: The Scottish government approved a large wind farm development in Shetland that is opposed by some locals but supported by others for its potential economic and renewable energy benefits.

34396551: Fifa president Sepp Blatter accused of making a "disloyal payment" of $2m to Uefa president Michel Platini, who denies wrongdoing but is being investigated as a witness and accused person.
39720944: John Higgins reaches the World Snooker Championship semi-final for the first time since 2011, believing he can win the title.
35884842: Pte Paul Wilkinson claims he asked Pte Cheryl James to choose between him and her boyfriend, but denies any involvement in her death at the Deepcut army barracks in 1995.

31995230: Charminster bridge in Dorset will be replaced with a new one with larger arches to improve river flow, while retaining the historic character and materials of the original 16th Century structure.
38632129: Chelsea are back in control of their Premier League destiny after an impressive 3-0 win at Leicester City, despite the sudden falling out with influential striker Diego Costa.

30745137: The Hoegh Osaka, a vehicle transporter, is being pumped of 3,000 tonnes of water after it unexpectedly refloated itself and was secured two miles east of the Bramble Bank sandbank, with poor weather conditions hampering salvage efforts.
26553115: The study suggests that water may be stored deep in the interiors of many rocky planets, with as much water trapped in rocks as there is in all the oceans.
37872311: Paul Nuttall, a former deputy leader, is backed by Peter Whittle as the best candidate to lead UKIP and ensure the Brexit vote is respected.
35553131: The Aberdeen-born artist has been awarded the RSGS's Livingstone Medal for raising awareness of the global HIV/AIDS pandemic.
39038936: The FBI is being sued by news organizations seeking information about the security firm or group of hackers that helped unlock the iPhone used by the San Bernardino shooter, with the organizations arguing that the public has a right to know how the government compromised the digital security of millions of Americans.
38735486: Vern Cotter, the New Zealand-born Scotland rugby coach, reflects on his eventful two-and-a-half-year tenure, his time in France, and his upcoming departure to Montpellier, as he aims to deliver a strong finish in his final Six Nations campaign.

37443011: The Willow Tea Rooms Trust is refurbishing the Sauchiehall Street building, originally designed by Mackintosh, while the tea rooms business has relocated to the nearby Watt Brothers store.

35613141: England's 134-8 was not enough as South Africa chased down the target in the final over, with Chris Morris' unbeaten 17 off 7 balls securing the win.

35862754: Widnes Vikings are leading the Super League table after seven games, thanks to their strong defense and high-scoring offense.
36080615: The Great Barrier Reef is experiencing its worst coral bleaching event on record, with only 7% of the reef showing no signs of bleaching, linked to rising water temperatures due to global warming and El Nino.

39747536: Carlos Vela and Juanmi scored for Real Sociedad as Granada suffered a fourth successive defeat under manager Tony Adams.
34218396: Twelve men were convicted for the 2006 Mumbai train bombings that killed 189 people, with one acquitted, and face the death penalty or life in prison.

35828022: Greek coach Skafidas admitted to nine rule violations involving sprinter Wilson, who was banned for doping in 2011 and 2015.

31768588: Edinburgh's 23-year-old player has undergone shoulder surgery and is expected to be out for up to six months.
